file_content.text: Bolan, I need to disable some kind of Rakata security system. Can you help me?
Best slicers in the galaxy. We've been studying the readouts of the device you found earlier, and I think we've got a handle on it.
If we can't do it, no one can. Patch us in when you're ready.
Jackpot, Sith. Let's ride this droid home. Find that Rakata device and scan it.
Stuff you're looking for is at the Republic labs.
That diagram's ancient alien tech, all right. Never seen it in my life. But Grokan saw something like this part here in the Republic labs.
They used it for their tests, to get data off of me. Don't know what, though.
There's rumors of the kind of crazy stuff those aliens built deeper in the prison. Advanced AIs, self-healing droids, living cities.
You said this is some kind of healing device? I can kind of see that. Hard to say, though, without a scan. Them Rakata freaks built some twisted stuff.
I would expect nothing less. How do I acquire this machine and then, how do I use it?
Sounds promising.
What was the place your friend said he saw it?
Where was it again?
Republic labs.
I don't have time for guesses. I need to know it'll work.
But will it work?
If you can scan that device, we can get you a better idea of what this thing is and how it works.
Here. Data chip. It'll re-program the Republic security droids in the area to open up the labs so you can get in and scan the device.
Thank you.
You find us this piece, we'll find you the mystery machine. No question.
What are labs doing as part of a prison?
Labs?
Can't say for sure. Figure it's something crazy if the Republic's come all the way out to Belsavis to do it.
You sure this will work?
How do you think the Empire caused this break, huh? I had these droids figured from day one.
Take this with you. It'll let us analyze the Rakata prize without you having to drag it back here, yeah?
Just watch the prisoners in the area. They're meaner than most.
Nice work on the beacon. Guess we owe you some info, huh.
We need that beacon set up. Can't help you 'til then.
Three hundred transistors. Three hundred. Sweet stuff, man. Sweet stuff.
Hey hey. What's this? You bring something juicy? Processor chip? Crazy Sith crystal tech?
Will trade for shuttle passes. No, just kidding. We love it here. Some real crazy tech. The droids don't even speak Basic!
I'm looking for an ancient healing technology. What have you got?
I need to contain my power.
Are you the ones that call yourselves the Circle?
Nikto slicers, hmm.
You got it. Circle like circuit. Everything's connected. The galaxy is one big machine and all our cells are like tiny little droids.
I never met a Nikto who could speak Basic.
You speak Basic?
Chip plus brain plus Basic language upgrade program equals sweet success. Might try Trandoshan, Shyriiwook someday.
Hear that? Bzzzzz. Sweet electrical music. Could listen to that all day. You need something?
I'm Zash's apprentice. She said you would know how to find some tech for me.
I heard you could help.
Zash. Zash. Let me just pull it up in the old memory banks. Oh, yeah! Funny lady. Tell me what you're looking for....
I'm very sick, and I heard there was some ancient healing technology to be found on Belsavis.
I'm looking for Rakata tech.
Got some old kolto injectors and a couple creepy-looking med droids, but nothing ancient. You got details?
I need you to examine some writings for me and build me the thing they describe.
Take a look at this.
If you can think it, we can build it. Let me have a look.
That's some crazy-looking diagram. But I'm pretty sure we can help.
Course when we helped Zash, she did something for us in return, yeah?
Course last time we helped one of you, she did something for us, yeah?
Freakish monstrosities. They won't talk to us like that. We are Sith!
What do you need me to do?
That's not your call.
I don't need to take nonsense from you.
You're right. [Shock Nikto.]
Get out of my head!
Shut up!
Easy now. Nobody's in your head. We'll help you, all right? Just calm down.
A little trouble for a little tech?
That depends on what you want me to do.
What do you need?
If it's trouble you want, I have plenty to spare.
Trouble, eh. [Shock him.]
Aggghhh! All right, all right! Just don't fry my chip, okay?
Aggghhh! All right, all right. Cost my life stealings to get a Basic-language chip in my brain. I don't need it fried.
I'll do what I must to buy your assistance.
Of course.
This is a state-of-the-art slicing hub in the making. Belsavis security protocols, HoloNet, we want it all.
The vault blows up our signal, makes it huge. Unbelievable. But we need a relay to carry it offworld. Go galactic or go home.
All we need is you to clear out a spot for our relay and protect it while we hook in.
You clear us out a spot for our relay and protect it while we hook in, we'll help you with your mystery machine.
It's a deal.
Fine.
I have better things to do. Give me what I want now.
Forget it. [Shock him.]
You do this for us, the Circle will be everywhere. You won't regret it.
You just head to the Republic labs and zap the scientists like you zapped me. One of them'll point you the way.
It's been a long time since I've had a chance to torment a scientist.
This will be fun.
Whatever expands your mind.
What if I don't want to "zap" them?
Is there another way?
Now you find a conscience? Sorry, Sith, got nothing else for you.
If I must.
